reviews.review_msg: I took several classes with him. Really interesting, expands your consideration of IS topics. Sometimes the subjects are too theoretical and hard to put into practice aside from helping you conceptualize issues. Really great with students, most of liked him when I had him! Great anecdotes. Could use more practical/"real-life" application in cours

One of the most interesting professors I have had. Don't let his appearance fool you. Be prepared for discussion as the majority of the class is seminar. Highly intellectual and humorous. Take a class with this guy!

Be prepared to participate in class conversation. He's great at giving you the context of the readings in class. He's not interested in just giving you answers and will push you to figure it out yourself. Defintely worth taking his class just know that he'll make you work for your grade. No final just term paper.

Dr. Cooper is a genuinely nice professor and person. It's really awesome the amount of knowledge she has in the subject area she's teaching and her passion definetly comes through. However, for not a W course we were required to write 4 major essays with not much time in between. Still would take classes with her in the future!

Many students struggled with the course due to a lack of sociological imagination. Thus, having a good understanding on sociology was highly recommended! All in all, it was a good course, and she was really helpful!
